ThingDef.label: apple tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows apples and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: bamboo
ThingDef.description: A fast growing grass and wood alternative.

ThingDef.label: banana tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows banana and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: beans
ThingDef.description: Common bean cooked up in many ways.

ThingDef.label: blueberry bush
ThingDef.description: Blue colored berry that grows in bushes.

ThingDef.label: carrots
ThingDef.description: A long orange vegetable that can be tricky to grow.

ThingDef.label: cloudberry bush
ThingDef.description: A berry bush that grows well in cold climates.

ThingDef.label: cocoa plant
ThingDef.description: Cocoa beans are refined into chocolate.

ThingDef.label: coffee plant
ThingDef.description: A green, leafy planet yielding red cherries. These cherries contain seeds which, when ground, can be brewed into a tasty beverage.

ThingDef.label: corn
ThingDef.description: A large grain plant which produces ears of delicious yellow seeds. Takes a relatively long time to grow, but yields lots of food, takes a long time to spoil, and can be happily eaten raw. Needs fertile soil to grow well.

ThingDef.label: cotton bush
ThingDef.description: Yields cotton, a fine plant fiber used to make cloth.

ThingDef.label: date palm tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows dates and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: devilstrand mushroom
ThingDef.description: This fragile mushroom was genetically engineered to produce a silk net of the highest grade. Long rumored to have mystical properties, it owes its name to the greed it inspires in people.

ThingDef.label: eggplant
ThingDef.description: Purple variety of the eggplant. Bitter when eaten raw.

ThingDef.label: gooseberry bush
ThingDef.description: A berry bush that grows well in cold climates.

ThingDef.label: fig tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows figs and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: grape vine
ThingDef.description: A sweet small fruit that grows in small viney bushes.

ThingDef.label: haygrass
ThingDef.description: A mixture of nutrient-rich grasses which yield large amounts of hay. Hay is edible for animals, but not humans.

ThingDef.label: hops
ThingDef.description: A flowering plant that yields hops, and essential ingredient in beer.

ThingDef.label: lettuce
ThingDef.description: A large, easily grown vegetable that's excellent for salads.

ThingDef.label: mushrooms
ThingDef.description: This robust mushroom has been genetically engineered and cultivated to produce a filling meat substitute.

ThingDef.label: oats
ThingDef.description: A cereal grain.

ThingDef.label: OmniGel Plant
ThingDef.description: An OmniGel plant.

ThingDef.label: onions
ThingDef.description: Warning can make you cry!

ThingDef.label: orange tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows oranges and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: peach tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows peaches and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: pineapple plant
ThingDef.description: Think skin fruit that grows a top a bush.

ThingDef.label: potato plant
ThingDef.description: A simple, highly nutritious tuber. Grows well even in somewhat poor soil. Harvests quickly. A strong, versatile crop.

ThingDef.label: pumpkins
ThingDef.description: Large orange version of the squash plant. Often carved to ward off ghosts.

ThingDef.label: rice
ThingDef.description: A low grain plant that thrives in rich soil and yields food fast, but is not nice to eat uncooked.

ThingDef.label: spectago flowers
ThingDef.description: One of the few known breeds of photochromic flowers, each petal of the Spectago changes color throughout the month depending on how much light they are exposed to. Used to brew spectago tea.

ThingDef.label: squash
ThingDef.description: Yellow variety of the squash family.

ThingDef.label: strawberries
ThingDef.description: A fragile but tasty fruit. Delicious even when raw.

ThingDef.label: sugarcane
ThingDef.description: Cane plant refines into sugar.

ThingDef.label: tea plant
ThingDef.description: A green leafy plant, who's leaves can be brewed into a tasty beverage.

ThingDef.label: tobacco
ThingDef.description: A green, leafy member of the nighshade family. Harvests quickly. Demanding to grow, but an enjoyable crop.

ThingDef.label: tomato vine
ThingDef.description: Distinctive red fruit that grows best in rich soil.

ThingDef.label: watermelons
ThingDef.description: This fruit is rich in vitamins A and C and can be eaten raw or cooked in a variety of ways.

ThingDef.label: wheat
ThingDef.description: Wheat is a cereal grain, harvested into raw wheat.

ThingDef.label: xerigium
ThingDef.description: This plant was selectively bred for centuries by settlers. It is sometimes also called "healer's hand" by tribespeople - a nickname it owes to its five major medicinal virtues.
